授業目的: In this class, we will lecture on various Canadian circumstances, with a particular focus on social issues, politics, language policy, and economic relations between Japan and Canada.We will also touch on Canadian identity, art and culture, and daily life, thereby providing a deeper understanding of Canada. Deepen your understanding comprehensively.
到達目標:
By taking this lecture, students will be able to acquire the following points.
・Be able to understand the relationship between Kwansei Gakuin University and Canada.
- Gain basic knowledge about Canada's political system and political issues such as the Quebec issue.
- Understand Canadian identity and be able to sing the Canadian national anthem.
・Be able to understand social issues faced by modern Canada, such as the marijuana issue, and government policies, such as the official language policy.
・You can learn about Canadian art culture, life, and family forms.
関連科目: Introduction to Canadian Studies B, Topics in Canadian Studies, CCC Introduction to Multicultural Studies 1, 2 (in charge: Yato), English for Cross-Cultural Studies A,B (level 3) (in charge: Yato), Cross-Cultural College Global Career Seminar , mid-term study abroad at partner universities in Canada, exchange programs, double degrees with Mount Allison University, etc.
授業の概要・背景:
This class will be held in an omnibus format, inviting not only the person in charge of this class but also experts in various fields as instructors, in order for students to learn about Canadian circumstances and basic knowledge in an interdisciplinary manner. Classes taught by Canadian instructors are conducted in English.
*The content is different from "Introduction to Canadian Studies B," so students who have already taken "Introduction to Canadian Studies B" can take "Introduction to Canadian Studies A." You can choose either one first.
授業方法:
1. We are planning to hold lectures face-to-face, but if there are any changes to the class schedule, this information will be posted in the LUNA notifications section by the night before, so be sure to check it.
2. There are assignments for each class, and the overall score will be the grade for that class. No exams will be held during the final exam period. Submit each assignment by the deadline each time. The assignments given vary depending on the instructor who will be speaking, and may be essay questions such as reflection papers or answers to questions, or quizzes. There are two ways to submit: LUNA, and paper-based submissions.
3. Many of these classes will be based on textbooks, so please prepare your textbooks as soon as possible.

"Exploring Aging Demographics: Canada vs. Japan" will examine the challenges and opportunities of aging populations. Students will analyze age pyramids and dependency ratios. We will also discuss how population shifts can strain social safety nets and whether immigration can be a solution to these economic challenges.
「高齢化する人口統計の探求：カナダ対日本」において、私たちは高齢化する人口が直面する課題と機会を検討します。学生は年齢ピラミッドと依存比を分析することになります。さらに、人口の変動が社会保障ネットワークにどのような影響を与えるか、そして移民がこれらの経済的課題に対する解決策となり得るかどうかについて議論します。
